summary: My scholarship focuses on constructs of writing competence as perceived by students, teachers, writing assessment designers, and writing researchers. By examining the different ways writing is conceptualized and the potential effects of these conceptualizations on teaching and learning, my research ultimately aims to shed light on students' experiences transitioning from secondary to postsecondary writing demands in multilingual settings.
